name: FSF Ship Design
desc: A high level implementation of a ship-wide gravity field, the shell is designed to receive or transmit force to a nearby friendly ship. A fleet composed entirely of FSF ships can swiftly switch between different formations.

name: Missile Platform
desc:
An integrated missile factory has utilized all available space at the cost of maximum ammunition to continuously produce ammo. This applies to all missile weapons mounted in missile or composite slots.

This ship has a resource called %s which regenerates over time. Whenever a missile weapon is not full, this resource is consumed to produce ammo. The more costly the missile round, the greater the consumption.

name: FCS Radar
desc:
The wave radar provides half of the ship's targeting capability, with the other half being enhanced by this modification:

Weapon range %s

name: Limited Targeting System
desc:
An outdated but durable targeting system with mechanical computing, strong against any type of impact, whether physical or EMP.

Weapon range %s, durability %s, repair time in battle %s

name: Towline
desc: The powerful engine of this ship can tow a slower, friendly fleet member, allowing it to travel at the same speed.

name: Main Gun Swapper
desc: Remove this hullmod to switch between different built-in weapons.

name: Open Field Hanger
desc:
The large open deck at the center of the ship allows for the deployment of more fighters in a wing, but doubling the workload for a single LPC chip slightly reduces its performance.

All non-built-in wings will be infinitely redeployed to %s, but they deal %s damage to enemy ships.

name: Accelerated Gunnery
desc:
The fine-tuned control chip accelerates all movements related to weapon cycling. Only ships pre-built with above-average steel can withstand its long-term side effects.

Weapon Rate of Fire and ammo regeneration speed are %s. Their flux produced per shot also %s.

name: Cruise Missile Carrier
desc: A specialized cruise missile vessel allows you to load cruise missiles in the Intel page.

name: Anchored Self Rotate
desc: This module continuously rotates around its axis.

name: Module Targeting Unit
desc:
A simple but practical system for ship module targeting, heavily relying on the sensors of parent vessel makes common targeting modifications unavailable.

Weapon range %s

name: Attack Carrier
desc: Built to send fighters directly to enemy ships means high lost rate. To compensate the deficit in fighter refit rate, this ship can shortly overload its fighter forge quickly replacing all lost. Can't overload twice in short time and generate soft flux during cooldown

name: Strafe
desc:
This ship slowly regenerates strafe energy. Whenever a large weapon on the ship fires, consume strafe energy to accelerate its remaining cooldown.

Fully recharging strafe energy takes %s seconds; when fully charged, it can reduce %s seconds of cooldown in total and weapons with fire interval shorter than %s can't be accelerated.

If this ship's system is out of charge, it will consume %s of strafe energy to regain a charge. Everytime shipsystem activates, fires several low-power built-in missiles to distract enemy point defenses.

name: Pre-planted Explosive Reactive Armor
desc:
Explosive reactive armors (ERAs) are embedded beneath the main armor belt, designed to respond to severe impacts.

When the hull takes a damage that >= %s, one ERA activates, mitigating that damage by %s. The ship has a total of %s ERAs.

name: Composite Targeting System
desc:
A composite targeting system combines laser, radio, and optic rangefinding technologies, providing range bonuses similar to capital ship level.

Boosts non-PD weapons range by %s and PD weapon range by %s. However, weapon range beyond %s is reduced by %s.

name: High Speed Maneuver
desc: The compact hull and high speed of this ship allow it to dodge attacks, but keep doing so burden the engine and will eventually fail unless let engine get some rest.

name: Multi-turret Optimization
desc:
Part of the weapon structure is built into the slots.

Ballistic/energy weapon OP costs, from small to large, are reduced by %s/ %s/ %s.

name: Close Targeting
desc:
A PD-oriented targeting system helps PD weapons on smaller ships perform as effectively as those on capital ships.

Boosts PD weapon range by %s, optimize weapon recoil and spread by %s.

name: Titanic Killer
desc:
A dreadnought is designed to defeat an elite opponent.

Based on hull size, if the target's base DP exceeds a certain threshold, for every few DP above this ship deals %s damage, to a maximum of %s.

name: Twin Fighter
desc: The gunnery module at the front of the ship is an individual fighter that can be launched to coordinate and attack targets on the flank.

name: Elite Ship
desc:
This modification aimed to maximize the ship's defense, including a complete overhaul of all mechanical parts, using micro-drones to detect and fix even the smallest leaks within pipelines, and replacing the main armor belt with a superior material.

In addition to these standard improvements, a backup overload response system has been installed. This system includes a disposable drone that can deploy a ship-sized shield until the ship recovers.

name: Emergency Reconstruct
desc: Inspired by an automated ship design, an entire set of scaffolding is placed into compressed phase space. Once the ship sustains lethal damage, it initiates an emergency reconstruction process to fully restore its hull points and armor.

name: Controlled Shield
desc:
The specialized shield generator cooperates with the targeting system to harden the shield just before impact. However, it is incapable of tracking projectiles fired at close range.

For non-missile projectiles and beams that spawned outside %s su, shield damage taken %s. For missiles, shield damage taken %s. Weapon's base range are limited to %s.

name: Floating Shield
desc:
A specialized shield generator produces a liquid-like surface; the harder the impact, the more efficient it becomes.

For every %s flux raised due to shield absorbing damage, in the next %s seconds gains a small amount of shield damage reduction. This effect is stackable and damage reduction scales exponentially, to max of %s stacks where shield damage taken %s

name: Hot Loader
desc:
The recoil recycling device designed by the company exploits potential space to expand the magazine, thereby boosting ammunition regeneration.

Weapons' ammo regeneration speed %s
sModDesc: Ammo regen speed bonus changes to %s

name: Vanguard Hull
desc:
Improving the hull's hardness has been proven to offer little resistance against large anti-ship guns, but it significantly reduces damage from numerous smaller impacts.

Each time the hull takes damage, there is a %s chance to reduce it by %s.
sModDesc: Trigger chance changes to %s, damage reduction changes to %s

name: Strategy Thruster
desc: Being quicker in long-range repositioning is key to gaining a strategic advantage. This engine modification improves zero flux boost capability but comes at the expense of combat performance.

name: Type28 Shield Gen
desc: A miracle shield generator is installed on this ship, boasting an extraordinary damage absorption rate. However, as a trade-off, this hullmod is incompatible with any other modifications.

name: Cruise Missile Trigger S-1
desc: Trigger the explosion upon closing in.

name: Cruise Missile Trigger S-2
desc: Trigger the explosion upon closing in.

name: Fighter Armor Plate
desc:
Fighters' armor and structure sustain less damage, and their weapons and engines are less likely to be disabled.

Armor, structure, weapons, and engines take % less damage.

name: Tank Armor
desc: Armor automatically repairs itself to the maximum in a short time.

name: Projectile Denial Shield
desc: When a projectile hits the shield, remove it and increase hard flux equal to its damage.
